column4: Hi all, I m trying to get data from a sata disk I extracted from my older laptop that does not work anymore. Well, I try to mount it from <:de
from /dev/sdb but that does not work
/dev/sdb is a disk, not a partition, you mount a partition, not a desk
yeah I know, yet i dont have any /dev/sdb*
then there is no partition on that disk
you need to partition the disk
no there are partitions, I used this disk
you are mistaken, "sudo fdisk -l /dev/sdb"
does not return me nothing, i tried it :(
there are no partitions on that disk then
there is no partition on the disk - data is already gone
it's not mistaken
pastebin the output of "sudo fdisk -l" please
no output
are you running from a livecd ?
you used the command "sudo fdisk -l" yes? exactly like that ?
how did you become root ?
don't use "sudo su"
sudo -i
sudo fdisk -l output please.
http://pastie.org/1853035
I didn't ask for the syslog
look at what it's doing port 5 on the hub is disabling/up/down
thanks a lot
